overview:
Entrepreneur and start-up enthusiast. Since 1999, has founded three internet companies. goZing (sold in 2005), File123 (sold in 2010) and uSamp (started in 2008).

uSamp (uSamp.com), the Answer Network, is a premier provider of technology and survey respondents used to obtain consumer and business insights. The company’s core mission is to help businesses make better, faster decisions about their products and services by surveying the right people in real-time. The company’s web-based SaaS platform is transforming the way companies gain intelligence and insights by providing on-demand access to uSamp’s profiled audience of 8 million survey respondents and providing technology solutions for simple management of customer lists. uSamp’s proprietary technologies assist with obtaining faster insights through mobile survey/app technology, self-serve survey authoring, self-serve sampling and private-label panel management solutions. uSamp is based in Los Angeles, with five offices throughout the United States, Europe and India. The company has over 200 full time employees worldwide and is led by serial entrepreneurs Matt Dusig and Gregg Lavin.

uSamp Ranked #213 on 2012 Inc. 500/5000 List. uSamp Ranked #11 on Forbes 2011 List of America’s Most Promising Companies. uSamp CEO/President Named 2011 Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Finalist. uSamp Named 2011 Red Herring 100 Finalist. AlwaysOn Names uSamp to Global 250 Top Private Companies List for 2011. uSamp Named One of the Best Places to Work in L.A. by the Los Angeles Business Journal.

milestones.description: Formed United Sample, Inc.  Raised Series A from DFJ Frontier.
United Sample Raises Series B led by Greycroft Partners
milestones.source_description: United Sample Raises $3 Million Series B
